Dictionary.Name: The Free On-line Dictionary of Computing (27 SEP 03)

Definition.WordDefinition:
privacy
Where only the intended recipients can read a message.

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Privacy \Pri"va*cy\, n.; pl. {Privacies}. [See {Private}.] 1. The state of being in retirement from the company or observation of others; seclusion. [1913 Webster]
2. A place of seclusion from company or observation; retreat; solitude; retirement. [1913 Webster]
Her sacred privacies all open lie. --Rowe. [1913 Webster]
3. Concealment of what is said or done. --Shak. [1913 Webster]
4. A private matter; a secret. --Fuller. [1913 Webster]
5. See {Privity}, 2. [Obs.] --Arbuthnot. [1913 Webster]

privacy n 1: the quality of being secluded from the presence or view of others [syn: {privateness}, {seclusion}] 2: the condition of being concealed or hidden [syn: {privateness}, {secrecy}, {concealment}]
